creator: michael.khoury
title: Rig and Animate A Rigid Body Creature
materials_required: Meshmixer (or similar STL to OBJ converter)
description: This project outlines the process of rigging and animating a character or creature made of solid rigid bodies attached to a skeletal structure for animation. It involves exporting parts from Tinkerplay, converting them to a compatible format, assembling them in 3D software, creating a skeleton, weighting the mesh, and finally animating the rigged creature.
steps: Export the individual parts of the creature from Tinkerplay as .STL files.
Convert the .STL files to .OBJ format using Meshmixer or a similar program.
Import all the .OBJ meshes into your chosen 3D animation software. Position and rotate them to assemble the creature, ensuring the ball and socket joints align correctly.
Create an animation skeleton (rig) by placing joints at the center of each ball and socket intersection. Name each joint appropriately.
Weight each mesh part entirely to a single joint, or alternatively, parent each mesh part to its corresponding joint.
Animate the rigged creature, using IK handles or other animation tools to create movement. Set keyframes to define the animation cycle.
